activities:
Personal data is obtained primarily for data processing in the context of marketing activities.  These activities include:  Data cleansing, matching, standardization to facilitate initial data loads.  Subsequent processing of personal data may also include executing analytics processing against this data in order to further segment personal data (customers) into appropriate marketing segments.  

Once the above processing has been completed, the data may be accessed either via batch and/or real-time processing methods.  These methods include receiving new data from clients within the EU when such data becomes available.  Then executing the processing steps as described above, then potentially exporting back to the originating sender of the personal data.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: client, customer, visitor, purchase and organization data.  No data is processed manually.
